subject: Re: [junit] run from ANT with optional.jar
msgSnippet: ... optional.jar should be in whatever you ve downloaded.  And it has to be in the same CLASSPATH area as junit.jar (i.e. either they are both on the system
messageBody:
On Wed, 19 Mar 2003, wleana <li.wen@...> wrote:

> Hi, I am trying to run JUnit from ANT and I read the FAQ which
> instructs to put ant.jar in the same CLASSPATH as junit.jar. I did
> that, but still it doesn't work. I read about this optional.jar, but
> I couldn't find it anywhere in the ANT 1.5.2 that I downloaded.

optional.jar should be in whatever you've downloaded. And it has to
be in the same CLASSPATH area as junit.jar (i.e. either they are both
on the system classloader or neither of both).

ant.jar will be on the system classloader anyway (or Ant itself won't
work).

Where did you download what to get Ant 1.5.2?

Stefan
